trans-unit.source: The new Twitter v1.1 APIs requires your app to authenticate before accessing resources.
trans-unit.target: The new Twitter v1.1 APIs requires your app to authenticate before accessing resources.

trans-unit.source: First, you need to get the credentials needed to request access by using OAuth 2.0.
trans-unit.target: First, you need to get the credentials needed to request access by using OAuth 2.0.

trans-unit.source: Then, you will store them securely in the app settings for your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Then, you will store them securely in the app settings for your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't already done so, complete the steps in the topic Register your apps for Twitter login with Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't already done so, complete the steps in the topic Register your apps for Twitter login with Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: Twitter generates the credentials needed to enable you to access Twitter v1.1 APIs.
trans-unit.target: Twitter generates the credentials needed to enable you to access Twitter v1.1 APIs.

trans-unit.source: You can get these credentials from the Twitter Developers website.
trans-unit.target: You can get these credentials from the Twitter Developers website.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the Twitter Developers website, sign-in with your Twitter account credentials and select your Twitter app.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the Twitter Developers website, sign-in with your Twitter account credentials and select your Twitter app.

trans-unit.source: In the Keys and Access Tokens tab for the app, make a note of the following values:
trans-unit.target: In the Keys and Access Tokens tab for the app, make a note of the following values:

trans-unit.source: Consumer key
trans-unit.target: Consumer key

trans-unit.source: Consumer secret
trans-unit.target: Consumer secret

trans-unit.source: Access token
trans-unit.target: Access token

trans-unit.source: Access token secret
trans-unit.target: Access token secret

trans-unit.source: Log on to the [Azure Management Portal], click Mobile Services, and then click your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the [Azure Management Portal], click Mobile Services, and then click your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Click the Identity tab, enter the Consumer key and Consumer secret values obtained from Twitter, and click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click the Identity tab, enter the Consumer key and Consumer secret values obtained from Twitter, and click Save.

trans-unit.source: Click the Configure tab, scroll down to App settings and enter a Name and Value pair for each of the following that you obtained from the Twitter site, then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click the Configure tab, scroll down to App settings and enter a Name and Value pair for each of the following that you obtained from the Twitter site, then click Save.

trans-unit.source: TWITTER_ACCESS_TOKEN
trans-unit.target: TWITTER_ACCESS_TOKEN

trans-unit.source: TWITTER_ACCESS_TOKEN_SECRET
trans-unit.target: TWITTER_ACCESS_TOKEN_SECRET

trans-unit.source: This stores the Twitter access token in app settings.
trans-unit.target: This stores the Twitter access token in app settings.

trans-unit.source: Like the consumer credentials on the Identity tab, the access credentials are also stored encrypted in app settings, and you can access them in your server scripts without hard-coding them in the script file.
trans-unit.target: Like the consumer credentials on the Identity tab, the access credentials are also stored encrypted in app settings, and you can access them in your server scripts without hard-coding them in the script file.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [App settings].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [App settings].

trans-unit.source: http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=262293
trans-unit.target: http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=262293
